title: Calories in Eggplant Parmesan
meta_description: Discover calories in eggplant parmesan per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdowns for this classic Italian dish.
assumptions: Standard homemade serving (~250 g): breaded and fried eggplant slices layered with marinara sauce, mozzarella, and parmesan cheese; baked.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, frying method, cheese type, and brand of sauce. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving of eggplant parmesan provides about 350 kcal, with high carbs from breading and sauce.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of eggplant parmesan?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard 250 g serving.

faqs.q: Is eggplant parmesan high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, about 28 g carbs per serving, mostly from breading and tomato sauce.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in eggplant parmesan?
faqs.a: Around 14 g protein per serving, mainly from the cheeses.

faqs.q: How to make eggplant parmesan lower in calories?
faqs.a: Bake the eggplant instead of frying and use low-fat cheese to cut ~100 kcal.

faqs.q: Does eggplant parmesan have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 850 mg per serving from sauce and cheese; opt for low-sodium versions.
